channel.title: BBC News

item.title: How bitter Trump-Musk feud escalated - and what happens next
item.description: A knock-down fight between the world's most powerful politician and its richest person is playing out in public view.

item.title: Russia launches 'massive' strikes days after Ukrainian drone attack
item.description: Russia's drone and missile attack on Kyiv and other parts on Friday leaves at least three dead.

item.title: Netanyahu confirms Israel arming clans opposed to Hamas in Gaza
item.description: Israel has been criticised for giving weapons to a group of "criminals and felons".

item.title: Raids across Canary Islands in major cocaine gang bust
item.description: Police say smugglers used a network of speedboats to ferry drugs from South America to the Spanish islands.

item.title: North Korea refloats warship after failed launch
item.description: The failed launch drew harsh criticism from Kim Jong Un and led to the arrest of four officials.

item.title: Australian mushroom lunch cook tells trial meal was 'special'
item.description: Erin Patterson denies intentionally putting toxic fungi into a home-cooked meal to kill her relatives.

item.title: Israel strikes southern Beirut on eve of religious holiday
item.description: Israel's military says it was targeting an underground drone factory of armed group Hezbollah.

item.title: Bouncy castle operator cleared in tragedy that killed six
item.description: A court ruled the incident was "due to an unprecedented weather system".

item.title: Trump confirms China trip after 'very good' call with Xi
item.description: The leaders of the US and China agree to further talks aimed at reaching a deal amid an ongoing trade war.

item.title: New Zealand PM 'shock' as aide accused of secretly recording women
item.description: PM Christopher Luxon says he has "zero tolerance" for women being made to feel unsafe after allegations emerged.

item.title: Trump's new ban dodges pitfalls faced by last attempt, experts say
item.description: It appears the US president has learned lessons from a previous effort to ban entry from several nations.

item.title: Israeli military recovers two hostages' bodies in southern Gaza
item.description: Israeli Americans Judi Weinstein Haggai, 70, and her husband Gadi, 72, were killed during the 7 October 2023 attacks.

item.title: Trump and Musk: The 10 days that unravelled their relationship
item.description: Their feud began with Elon Musk's disappointment over a bill - now Trump is considering selling his Tesla.

item.title: Israeli army admits to Gaza strike after BBC Verify investigation
item.description: At least one Palestinian was killed and 30 others injured in the Israeli strike on tents in Khan Younis on Sunday, medics say.

item.title: 'We have a geriatric problem' - Democrats wrestle with age-old issue
item.description: Democrats are wondering what to do with aging candidates after revelations about Joe Biden's health.

item.title: The country where the left (not the far right) made hardline immigration laws
item.description: Denmark has come under international attention for its tough approach. And its Social Democrat prime minister is leading the charge

item.title: Nato chief is determined to give Trump a win with 5% defence spending plan
item.description: Some may ask if Mark Rutte's proposal to deter Russian aggression has at least a little to do with appeasing the US president, writes Jonathan Beale.

item.title: Tied up and blindfolded: How BBC team was held at gunpoint by Israeli forces in Syria
item.description: BBC Arabic's Feras Kilani and his colleagues were held at gunpoint, bound and strip-searched while filming in the Golan Heights.

item.title: Why has Trump banned travel from these countries?
item.description: The new restrictions primarily affect African and Middle Eastern nations, with a range of justifications given.

item.title: What we know about Trump's latest travel ban
item.description: President Donald Trump signs a proclamation banning nationals from 12 countries from travelling to the US.

item.title: India leads in remittances - but Trump's tax could deal a blow
item.description: Trump's proposed 3.5% tax on remittances by foreign workers could seriously impact top recipient India.

item.title: 'I was pushed across the India border into Bangladesh at gunpoint'
item.description: The BBC met people in India's Assam who say they were accused of being illegal immigrants and forced across the border.

item.title: 'I begged for help, but only God answered': Growing dangers of pregnancy and childbirth in Gaza
item.description: Rather than representing the hope of new life, babies in Gaza have come to epitomise the struggle to survive.

item.title: 'All Jewish Americans are questioning their security' after violent antisemitic attacks
item.description: Community leaders say people are anxious after recent attacks in Boulder and Washington DC showed that “anyone, anywhere” could be targeted.

item.title: On the hunt for Tiger, the fugitive linked to illegal South African gold mine where 78 died
item.description: The BBC tracks down people close to the alleged crime kingpin who escaped custody while awaiting trial.

item.title: The Today Debate: Israel-Gaza - are we witnessing war crimes?
item.description: The BBC’s Anna Foster hosts a debate to discuss whether there have been war crimes in Israel and Gaza.

item.title: Jeremy Bowen: Killings near Gaza aid centre will deepen criticism of Israel's new distribution system
item.description: Western diplomats are looking on with dismay at the killing of hungry Gazans near aid hubs, writes Jeremy Bowen.

item.title: How Ukraine carried out daring 'Spider Web' attack on Russian bombers
item.description: On 1 June, more than 100 Ukrainian drones struck strategic targets deep into Russia in an elaborate and audacious operation.

item.title: Ukraine's audacious drone attack sends critical message to Russia - and the West
item.description: The BBC's Paul Adams reflects on the impact of Ukraine's major drone attack on Russian bombers.

item.title: 'Two egos going at it' - Americans react to Trump-Musk feud
item.description: Americans have been reacting to the souring relationship between Donald Trump and Elon Musk.

item.title: Watch: D-Day 'not a pleasant day for you', Trump tells German chancellor
item.description: This is the first meeting between both leaders since Friedrich Merz won the election on 6 May.

item.title: Watch: City buses go up in flames in Philadelphia
item.description: As many as 40 decommissioned buses were damaged in the fire, according to officials

item.title: Watch: Hungry elephant wanders into Thai grocery store
item.description: The elephant helped himself to nine bags of sweet rice crackers, a sandwich and some bananas, shopkeepers say.

item.title: Watch: Three things you need to know about the mushroom murder trial
item.description: As Erin Patterson continues to give evidence, the BBC looks at what the key takeaways are so far.

item.title: Ros Atkins on... The White House claims on BBC Gaza coverage
item.description: On Tuesday White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt launched an attack on the BBC's coverage of reports that Israeli forces had killed Palestinians near an aid distribution centre in Gaza. She claimed that the BBC took down a story after reviewing footage. The BBC has said the claim is completely wrong and that it stands by its journalism. Ros Atkins from BBC Verify takes a look at the facts.
